Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

    Board

    This class handles the logic associated with a game of chess

    Since:
    2020-1-17

    • Field Detail

      • blnServer

        public boolean blnServer
        Boolean describing which colour the player is. True is white and false is black

      • blnInCheck

        public boolean blnInCheck
        Boolean used to check if a player is in check state

      • pieces

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces
        ArrayList of piece objects used in the game

      • pieceLookup

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​Piece> pieceLookup
        HashMap holding key piece references to make accessing easier

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> captured
        ArrayList of piece objects that have been captured

      • givesCheck

        public boolean givesCheck()
        Checks to see if a move gives check to the opponent
        Returns:
        return true if there was a check

      • inCheck

        public boolean inCheck​(boolean blnTemp)
        This will check if after making a move the king is still in check. If the function returns true than then king is still in check and that causes the move to be illegal
        Parameters:
        blnTemp - if you are using the temporary board or not.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the piece is in check false if it is not

      • deepCopy

        public int[][] deepCopy​(int[][] intBoard)
        Creates a copoy of the contents of an array. Without sharing a refrence
        Parameters:
        intBoard - a two dimensinoal array
        Returns:
        A copy of the array that was passed in

      • stillInCheck

        public boolean stillInCheck​(java.lang.String strMove)
        Checks if a move puts the king in check
        Parameters:
        strMove - the move that is about to be made
        Returns:
        true if the move puts you in check. False if it does not

      • checkmate

        public boolean checkmate()
        Checks if a move gives checkmate
        Returns:
        true if checkmate, false if king is able to escape

      • executeMove

        public boolean executeMove​(Piece piece,
                           int intXPos,
                           int intYPos)
        Executes a move based on the final x and y position of a mouse
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece being moved
        intXPos - Physical x-position of the piece on the screen
        intYPos - Physcial y-position of the piece on the screen
        Returns:
        true if the move is possible, false if it is not
